header.note: The source node in most cases contains the sample message as written by the developer. If it looks like a dot-delimitted string such as "form.label.firstname", then the developer has not provided a default message.

trans-unit.target: Hello! My name is Beneylu Jim, i'll take you on a tour of your digital classroom and show you where everything is. Here we go!
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Your first steps on Beneylu School
Your first steps on Beneylu School
Are you ready for the next step?
I'm going to continue to explore by myself, before creating accounts for my students.
I want to create accounts for my students.
Your first steps on Beneylu School
Click on Applications.
Welcome to your classroom. To get started, click on “Applications” at the bottom right of your screen.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target:
Here is the application panel. This is the control center of your class.

This is where you open or close an application to students.

The application panel also allows you to change between workspaces. Go to a work group or the School space if you are a subscriber.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Access your classroom activities (Space Operations etc...)
This is where your class applications are stored
Browse each blue dot to learn about the application panel.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click here to disconnect. See you soon!
Have a look at Beneylu Spot to install all the applications you like
You can switch between workspaces by clicking on the name of each space.
Go through each blue dot to learn about the applications.
Here is your classroom! This is a shortcut to the homepage.
Lets take a closer look at your class' applications
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: The Media Library allows you store all of your classroom materials.
The Messaging App allows you to exchange messages with your students.
Use the profile to introduce yourself. You can choose your avatar, publish a status and talk about yourself.
The directory lists all the people in the class: the students, the parents and the teacher.

Good news, there are more applications to discover!

You choose the ones you need for the class at any time.

By clicking on "Add an Application" you enter Beneylu Spot, our resource marketplace. Here you'll find everything you need for your class: homework planer, blog, calendar...

When you download an application, it'll then appear in your app panel.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: See the little red dot under the Media Library icon? This indicates that the application is closed, your students won't be able to access it.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click on "Manage my applications."
To open the media library, go to the application panel.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click on the button so that the light changes to green to open the application.
In "Manage our Applications" you choose to open or close an application to students and their parents.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click on the star.
Super, the button is green. The media library is open. And if you added a shortcut to access it from the home page...
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target:
Then the Media Library will now appear in the navigation bar. This shortcut is visible to the whole class

To remove an app from the navigation bar, just uncheck the star next to that app
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Click on "view our applications"
Return to the applications in your class to see the result.
trans-unit.note: This text contains HTML tags, please try to keep those tags

trans-unit.target: Congratulations you have just opened your first application.
